There are apparently many frozen embryos left over from fertility clinics. The question for this thread is - what is the best thing to do with those embryos?
 
 Of course, the couple themselves can use more embryos for having more children. A few other options that come to mind include:
 1) Keep them frozen for perpetuity.
 2) Allow them to be used for stem cell research.
 3) Allow other infertile couples to "adopt" them.
 
 In my own opinion, all of those options are acceptable - though the third one might pose some legal difficulties of who "owns" the embryos (ex. the biological parents of the embryo might need to give permission). 
 
 Some might argue that generating frozen embryos is itself immoral and should not be used for fertility treatment.
 
 Of course, this discussion ties in with the abortion debate since it deals with the moral issue of treatment of very early human life.
 
 What are your views on the subject?
